metadata.synopsis: The player finds a book on necromancy - from one of the Red Wizards of Thay. Once read, the book will be bound to whoever tried to read it. Some origins will demand you let them read it, while others will want the book burned. If you read the book, you'll hear strange, distant whispers. The more you read, the stronger the voices will become, and the greater the chance that you'll be driven mad.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. loadlevel WLD_Main_A2. goto -648.75, -1.51, -361.753. Interact with Necromancy of ThayTo open book:1. Select Player Character2. In ReCon enter: SetCharacterOsirisFlag FOR_DangerousBook_State_HasTomeKey3. Interact with the Tome again.

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *You feel its connection. Its longing to be opened - to share its secrets.*

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *You open the book to the first page, with its shifting glyphs and strange whispers.*

152.speaker: Narrator
152.text: *You open the book where you left off, the glyphs dancing before your eyes.*

132.speaker: Narrator
132.text: *You open the book where you left off, and the voices return, chiding you for your indecision.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Read on and wrest the book's power from it.

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *As you parse the strange glyphs, you can feel the book resisting. Ghostly voices whisper at you from the dark - probing and fighting your mind.*

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *But your will is iron and you brush past these shades of the past, devouring every secret the book has to offer.*

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *You see now, life and death are malleable as clay, to be bent and reshaped by your will. By your power.*

151.speaker: Narrator
151.text: *But as you close the book, a nagging doubt whispers in your mind. What consequences will there be for calling the dead from their rest?*

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *Assailed from all sides, you careen through the text, absorbing knowledge you can barely comprehend. And yet, for all the violence, you start to see.*

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *As you look into the book's amethyst eyes, you can almost hear a voice. You just have to open the book, and it will be yours. Forever.*

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *Necromantic power flows from the pages of the book. There is nothing more for you here.*

104.speaker: Narrator
104.text: *The book is locked tight, with no visible keyhole - only an oval recess in the cover's mouth.*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *You try to examine the book, but the longer you stare, the more those piercing, amethyst eyes draw you in.*
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: examining the cover, staring at the eyes

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *Beneath the allure, you feel the faintest echo of torment. There is great power in this book, but also great suffering.*

153.speaker: Lae'zel
153.text: A cursed book? How obvious. Whoever opens it deserves the fate that befalls them.

126.speaker: Shadowheart
126.text: Curious. Why don't you take a closer look... I'll observe from back here.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: Please don't open the creepy book.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: That looks terribly heavy. Why don't you let me carry it for you?

24.speaker: Wyll
24.text: We surely shouldn't just leave such a threat out, where anyone could stumble across it.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Place the amethyst in the slot on the book's cover.

43.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places an amethyst in the book's cover. The book's latch springs open in the player's hands.

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *The book's pull is irresistible; you feel changed, bettered, for having opened it. Suddenly, you are capable of anything - felling mountains, darkening suns, conversing with the dead.*
124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player opens the book and is drawn to the pages.

134.speaker: Narrator
134.text: *So much promised... but what is sought in return?*
134.context: InternalNodeContext: Optional narration for sorcerer-tagged players.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Well. Quite the page turner. I'll get back to it when I have more time to focus.
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snaps the book shut.InternalNodeContext: Astarion talking to himselfNodeContext: He could feel himself getting pulled into the book and had to fight to close it. He snaps back to the world a little shaken.

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *Glyphs shift gently before your eyes. Words slip into your mind, onto your lips, forming words you don't understand. And something is trying to reply.*
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *The symbols dart beneath your eyes, warping and twisting. Your head throbs, but you almost understand.*
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Words continue to move on page, the visuals at the edge of the screen intesify

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *All you can see are those symbols. All you can hear are the whispers - there is nothing else.*
87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on the reader's reaction. Player would hear a bunch of indistinct voices talking at once

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Stay on the page, listen to the book. Try to connect with the magic bound within it.

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *The glyphs swarm impatiently. The book wants you to turn the page, to delve deeper. It's hungry.*
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Refuse the book. Muster your willpower and force the magic to reveal its nature.

138.speaker: Narrator
138.text: *The glyphs seem to burn your inner eye, outraged at your denial.*
138.context: CinematicNodeContext: VFX of glyphs and shadows intensify. Instinct voices grow more agitated

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *Within the pages, you feel a feral thrashing. Living magic, driven mad by what it was used for...*
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *Necromancy. The magical energies of all living things were stolen, corrupted, and sealed in this vile book. It wants someone to share in its insanity.*
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Concentrate your energy on the book. Channel a sense of calm onto its pages.

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *The magic inside the book is too strong. The voices grow louder - a cacophony.*
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glyph VFX intensifies again, reaching a peak.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Channel your magic into the final line. 'Now poor Barry's got a hag he must marry.'

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *Your limerick's final line pierces something within the book's roiling, vengeful magic.*
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glyph VFX eases and slows, then stops.

115.speaker: Narrator
115.text: *The voices falter, the anger quells. The magic seems to grow still and quiet, like a soothed beast.*
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glyph VFX eases and slows, then stops.

119.speaker: Narrator
119.text: *Nothing. Just old parchment covered in arcane symbols. The magic sleeps.*
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: All glyph/shadow VFX gone. Player looking downward at the page, observing

105.speaker: Narrator
105.text: *The heavy cover thumps shut with a strange finality.*

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *Pain grips your mind. The book will not be denied - it will make you read on, or force you to retreat.*
91.context: CinematicNodeContext: VFX of glyphs and shadows intensify. Instinct voices grow more agitated

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *All you can see are those symbols. All you can hear are the whispers - there is nothing else.*
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on the reader's reaction. Player would hear a bunch of indistinct voices talking at once

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Drown the book's voice with verse. 'There was a young hero called Barry...'

131.speaker: Player
131.text: '... Who had to best a tough quest and not tarry. It was going quite well, 'til he fell under a spell...'

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Turn to the next page, wary of any arcane tricks.

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *The symbols move aggressively, probing your mental defences, but you hold strong. For now.*

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Ask your patron to guard your mind and turn to the next page.

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *The symbols move aggressively, probing your mental defences. Your patron is there to defend you, but there's only so much they can do.*

117.speaker: Narrator
117.text: *The world around you is gone - you can only see those glyphs, only hear those voices.*
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Words continue to move on page, the VFX reach their peak intensity at this page

123.speaker: Narrator
123.text: *You feel claws moving in the shadows. They pull at you, dragging you closer.*

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Urge your hand to turn another page.

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *The glyphs scream, branding your mind with strange runes. You see time rewritten - fate undone - your future thrumming with power.*

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *You struggle to cling to scraps of what you know - powerful necromancy, you're sure - but it darts away, leaving only Hells' screams.*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *The book snaps closed. You've seen too much. What profane knowledge is now seared inside of you, you should never have known.*

76.speaker: Narrator
76.text: *The glyphs scream, searing your mind. You feel lost, tossed in a sea of arcane power you can neither control nor comprehend.*

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: *You try to close the book, but claws tear at you from the darkness. You can feel them on your body - in your soul, scratching and tearing at your sanity.*

140.speaker: Narrator
140.text: *The claws try to grip your hands, try to stop you, but you slam the book shut before they can take you.*
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player slams the book shut

154.speaker: Narrator
154.text: *The whispers, the pain - it all disappears in an instant. You are yourself again.*

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Welcome the darkness in the name of your god and turn the page.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Drink in the darkness, embracing it, and turn the page.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Face the darkness with your own, delve deeper.

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *Every symbol seems to burn your eyes. You can feel them searing into your mind - into your soul.*

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *The whispers, the pain - it all disappears in an instant. You are yourself again.*

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Drop the tome, ready to destroy it.

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *You feel better the second the book is out of your hands.*
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: PC drops the book on the ground and draws their melee weapon.

133.speaker: Astarion
133.text: You can't be serious. Give it to me this instant!

149.speaker: Narrator
149.text: *The voices return. Louder. Stronger. Commanding you to stop...*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *...but they have no hold on you. All you have to do is strike.*

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: What are you doing? That's no way to treat a book!

26.speaker: Astarion
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes the book and opens it

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *You don't know what he read, but it had an effect. His eyes are hungry, but pained.*

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: Well. Quite the page turner. I'll get back to it when I have more time to focus.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snaps the book shut.NodeContext: He could feel himself getting pulled into the book and had to fight to close it. He snaps back to the world a little shaken.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Tuck the book into your pack.

98.speaker: Narrator
98.text: *You can sense something dark about this tome - something profane.*

94.speaker: Narrator
94.text: *You've seen similar books in wizards' libraries - a tome on Thayan magic. A rare and expensive find, but people have gone mad reading less dangerous texts.*

118.speaker: Narrator
118.text: *The book refuses to open - for you, at least.*

137.speaker: Narrator
137.text: *You've seen much of the book, but its most powerful secrets are guarded by indecipherable glyphs. Without a key, they may be locked away forever.*

145.speaker: Narrator
145.text: *As you look into the book's amethyst eyes, you can almost hear a voice. You just have to open the book, and it will be yours. Forever.*
